title: Direct Link docs
introduction: The IBM Cloud Direct Link solution is designed to seamlessly connect your on-premises resources to your cloud resources. Leverage the docs, CLI, and API reference to plan for, provision, and manage your direct links.

section_recommended.title: Ordering Direct Link Dedicated
section_recommended.description: Terminate a single-tenant, fiber-based, cross connect into your own IBM Cloud private network connection. Also used by colocation facilities adjacent to IBM Cloud PoPs and data centers.

section_recommended.title: Ordering Direct Link Connect
section_recommended.description: Fast setup! Leverage a service provider to quickly establish and deliver connectivity to IBM Cloud locations. Ideal for multi-cloud environments with your service provider's network.

section_videos.title: IBM Cloud Direct Link for hybrid cloud

tiles.title: Behavior change: Enable service network routes from Direct Link to non-Classic connections
tiles.description: When a direct link is connected to a transit gateway, the direct link advertises all service network routes.

tiles.title: VLAN tagging support for Direct Link Dedicated
tiles.description: VLAN's keep traffic from different networks separated when traversing shared links and devices within a topology. This process, also known as VLAN tagging, limits broadcast network traffic and secures network segments.
